summary: This document is a series of email exchanges on July 28, 2019, concerning the conditions and psychological state of inmate Jeffrey Epstein while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It details his complaints about meals, a malfunctioning toilet, and physical symptoms like numbness, as well as administrative decisions regarding his cell assignment and suicide watch status.

events.title: Epstein's Custody Complaints and Monitoring
events.description: Email exchanges detail inmate Jeffrey Epstein's complaints about receiving only one meal (a sandwich at 4:15 PM), a toilet that ran for 45 minutes causing him to urinate in a cup, and physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck. Administrative decisions are discussed, including not moving him to another cell for lunch and plans to move him if the toilet issue persists.

events.title: Inmate Lopez Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: An administrative update states that inmate Lopez (#20472-038) is being taken off suicide watch.

keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein complained of only receiving one meal (a sandwich at ~4:15 PM) despite being in the Attorney Conference room from 8 AM to 8 PM.
Epstein reported a malfunctioning toilet that ran for 45 minutes, which he found so aversive he resorted to urinating in a cup.
Epstein reported physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck, and an inability to make a fist with his right hand.
A decision was made that Epstein would not have lunch in the Attorney Conference room but would return to his cell to eat.
Another inmate, Lopez (#20472-038), was being taken off suicide watch on the same day.
